original_title: Chinese, Afghan FMs vow to deepen cooperation, combat terrorism
article_summary: China and Afghanistan pledge to deepen cooperation in economy and counterterrorism, with a focus on maintaining stability, development, and security in both countries. Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi emphasized the importance of managing security and development effectively, and both leaders expressed a desire to strengthen security cooperation and combat the East Turkestan Islamic Movement. The meeting marks the 70th anniversary of diplomatic relations between the two nations, and both sides aim to increase cooperation in areas such as trade, agriculture, and cultural exchanges.</s>
